intro: Iria pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered iria, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while its stems are hairy and somewhat woody. Iria pauciflora is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical forests.
